workflow.name: Automated workflow test runner with Google Drive, Sheets & ClickUp result logging
workflow.description:
## Description
This workflow acts as a CI/CD-style test harness for validating other n8n workflows. It executes a target workflow (here: Archive Payment Receipts), evaluates pass/fail outcomes, and generates structured reports. Results are automatically archived to Google Drive, logged in Google Sheets, and synced with ClickUp for visibility. Both success and failure scenarios are handled with standardized formatting.

## What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
1. ‚ö° Manual Trigger ‚Äì Start the test run manually.
2.  ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Execute Target Workflow Under Test ‚Äì Calls the specified workflow (Archive Payment Receipts) and captures its output, even if it errors.
3.  ‚úÖ Test Result Evaluation (If Node) ‚Äì Checks if the output contains errors.
- Pass Path ‚Üí success formatting + archival.
- Fail Path ‚Üí failure formatting + logging.
-  üìÑ Format Success Test Result (Set Node) ‚Äì Creates a structured result object with:
- Status: ‚úÖ Passed
- Workflow Name
- Timestamp
-  üìÑ Format Failed Test Result (Set Node) ‚Äì Same as above, but with ‚ùå Failed status.
-  üìù Generate Success/Failure Report Text (Code Node) ‚Äì Converts structured data into a human-readable report string.
-  üì¶ Convert Report to Text File ‚Äì Transforms the text into a .txt file for archiving.
-  ‚òÅÔ∏è Archive Reports to Google Drive ‚Äì Saves .txt files (success/failure) into the resume store folder with timestamped filenames.
-  ‚úèÔ∏è Update ClickUp Task (Success/Failure) ‚Äì Posts results directly into a ClickUp task for visibility.
-  üìä Log Error Details to Error Tracking Sheet (Google Sheets) ‚Äì Appends raw error objects to an error log sheet for debugging and trend analysis.

## Prerequisites
- Target workflow to test (e.g., Archive Payment Receipts)
- Google Drive folder for report storage
- Google Sheets (Error Log tab)
- ClickUp API credentials
- n8n instance

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Automates workflow regression testing
 ‚úÖ Captures pass/fail outcomes with full audit trail
 ‚úÖ Maintains error logs for debugging and reliability improvements
 ‚úÖ Keeps stakeholders updated via ClickUp integration
 ‚úÖ Supports compliance with archived test reports

## Perfect For
- Teams running workflow QA & testing
- Organizations needing audit-ready test reports
- DevOps pipelines with continuous validation of automations
- Stakeholders requiring real-time visibility into workflow health

workflow.name: Automated Test Run and Status Update

parameters.content:
## üîÑ Execute Target Workflow Under Test
**Action:**  
- Calls and executes the "Archive Payment Receipts" workflow as a sub-process.  
**Description:**  
- Runs the specified workflow and waits for its completion.  
- Configured to continue execution even if the sub-workflow encounters errors.  
- Captures the output (including any error objects) for validation in subsequent steps.  
- Critical for automated regression testing and CI/CD pipelines.

## ‚úÖ Test Result Evaluation (Pass/Fail Check)
**Action:**  
- Determines whether the sub-workflow executed successfully or failed.  
**Description:**  
- Checks if an "error" field exists in the returned JSON data.  
- **True Path (No Error):** Routes to success logging branch.  
- **False Path (Error Exists):** Routes to failure logging and error reporting branch.  
- Acts as the decision gateway for all downstream reporting actions.

## ‚òÅÔ∏è Archive Success Report to Google Drive
**Action:**  
- Uploads the success test report file to a designated Google Drive folder.  
**Description:**  
- Stores test results in the "resume store" folder for centralized access.  
- File name dynamically includes workflow name, status, and timestamp.  
- Provides a permanent record of successful test executions.  
- Supports compliance and audit trail requirements.

## üì¶ Convert Success Report to Text File
**Action:**  
- Transforms the formatted text into a downloadable .txt file.  
**Description:**  
- Prepares the success report for upload to Google Drive.  
- File naming includes workflow name, status, and timestamp for easy identification.  
- Supports long-term archival and audit requirements.

## üìÑ Generate Success Report Text
**Action:**  
- Formats test result data into a human-readable text report.  
**Description:**  
- Concatenates workflow name, pass status, and timestamp into a structured text block.  
- Output is used for file creation and task updates.  
- Ensures consistent formatting across all reporting channels.

## üéØ Format Success Test Result
**Action:**  
- Structures the test outcome data for successful workflow execution.  
**Description:**  
- Creates a standardized result object containing:  
  - Status: "‚úÖ Passed"  
  - Tested Workflow Name: "Retention Tracking Post-Hire"  
  - Timestamp: Current execution time  
- Prepares data for archival and notification in subsequent nodes.

## ‚ùå Format Failed Test Result
**Action:**  
- Structures the test outcome data for failed workflow execution.  
**Description:**  
- Creates a standardized result object containing:  
  - Status: "‚ùå Failed"  
  - Tested Workflow Name: "Retention Tracking Post-Hire"  
  - Timestamp: Current execution time  
- Ensures failure details are captured for debugging and audit trails.

## ‚òÅÔ∏è Archive Failure Report to Google Drive
**Action:**  
- Uploads the failure test report file to a designated Google Drive folder.  
**Description:**  
- Stores test results in the "resume store" folder alongside success reports.  
- Enables team members to review failed test runs without accessing n8n directly.  
- Facilitates root cause analysis and troubleshooting.

## üì¶ Convert Failure Report to Text File
**Action:**  
- Transforms the formatted text into a downloadable .txt file.  
**Description:**  
- Prepares the failure report for upload to Google Drive.  
- File naming convention matches success reports for consistent organization.  
- Critical for post-mortem analysis and debugging.

## üìÑ Generate Failure Report Text
**Action:**  
- Formats test result data into a human-readable text report.  
**Description:**  
- Concatenates workflow name, fail status, and timestamp into a structured text block.  
- Mirrors the success report structure for consistency.  
- Enables quick identification of failed test runs in logs and notifications.

nodes.name: Convert Success Report to Text File
Convert Failure Report to Text File
Archive Success Report to Google Drive
Archive Failure Report to Google Drive

parameters.content:
## ‚úèÔ∏è Update ClickUp Task with Failure Status
**Action:**  
- Posts the failure test result to a specific ClickUp task for team visibility.  
**Description:**  
- Updates task ID .. with formatted test outcome.  
- Alerts the team to failed test runs immediately.  
- Centralizes test monitoring in the project management platform.

## ‚úèÔ∏è Update ClickUp Task with Success Status
**Action:**  
- Posts the success test result to a specific ClickUp task for team visibility.  
**Description:**  
- Updates task ID with formatted test outcome.  
- Keeps project management tools synchronized with test results.  
- Enables real-time notifications to stakeholders without manual updates.

nodes.name: Update ClickUp Task with Success Status
Update ClickUp Task with Failure Status

parameters.content:
## üìä Log Error Details to Error Tracking Sheet
**Action:**  
- Appends error information to a dedicated error log in Google Sheets.  
**Description:**  
- Writes to the "error log sheet" tab in the "Interviewer Brief Pack" spreadsheet.  
- Captures raw error objects for detailed analysis.  
- Creates a queryable database of all test failures for trend analysis.  
- Supports continuous improvement of workflow reliability.

nodes.name: Log Error Details to Error Tracking Sheet

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

generic.label: 2021: The Year to Automate the New You with n8n

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
